address: 2800 E Observatory Rd, Los Angeles, CA 90027, USA
name: Griffith Observatory
description: Explore the wonders of our solar system and the galaxy at Griffith Observatory. Donated to the city over a century ago, the observatory offers free admission to an array of space and science exhibits, including a nationally recognized planetarium and public telescopes. Situated high on the south-facing slope of Mount Hollywood, the complex offers views of downtown Los Angeles, Hollywood, and the Pacific Ocean. Secure a spot outside after visiting the observatory to enjoy views of the Hollywood sign or the dramatic coastline. Make Griffith Observatory a part of your Los Angeles vacation plans using our Los Angeles trip planner .

name: Los Angeles Zoo & Botanical Gardens
description: At 54 hectare (133 acre), Los Angeles Zoo & Botanical Gardens houses more than 1,100 animals representing over 250 species and 7,400 plants categorized in 15 collections. In different exhibits that replicate the animals' natural habitat, you'll encounter mammals, birds, amphibians and reptiles, including 29 endangered species. Roam around a tropical rainforest featuring rivers, sculptures, and educational graphics, and see elephants play, rest, or roll around in sandy hills and bathing pools. Get a glimpse of gorillas, wild cats, and koalas on eucalyptus trees as you stroll past saltwater pools and rocky coves teeming with life. You'll have the chance to visit caves and desert trails. Check out the World of Birds show. Put Los Angeles Zoo & Botanical Gardens at the forefront of your travel plans using our Los Angeles travel route builder site .

address: 100 Universal City Plaza, Universal City, CA 91608, USA
name: Universal Studios Hollywood
description: For an ultimate Hollywood experience, visit Universal Studios Hollywood, a film studio, theme park, and a self-contained city all its own. One of the oldest Hollywood studios still in use, this show business complex considers itself "the entertainment capital of Los Angeles." Originally created to offer tours of real film studios, sets, and sound stages, the complex now offers live shows, thrill rides, and behind-the-scenes presentations about the movie-making process. To see the highlights, take a tram tour of the sound stages and sets designed specifically for some of the studio's biggest blockbusters. You can also choose from indoor and outdoor roller-coaster rides that provide you the chance to face King Kong, a shark attack, dinosaurs, and a powerful earthquake. Arrange to visit Universal Studios Hollywood and other attractions in Los Angeles using our Los Angeles trip tool .

address: 6400 Sunset Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90028, USA
name: Amoeba Music
description: Browse aisle after aisle of some of the biggest music legends at Amoeba Music, a retro-looking store offering new CDs, used CDs, DVDs, Bluerays, cassettes, and LP vinyls. The store is part of a chain, and with 250,000 titles, it remains one of the largest independent music shops in the world. Its retro appeal made it a Hollywood landmark almost instantly, its reputation made by a broad collection of music under one roof, showcased over its shopping floors and jazz room. The stock is ever changing as loyal customers come in to trade old for new, and vice versa. Add Amoeba Music to your Los Angeles travel itinerary, and discover new vacation ideas by using our Los Angeles holiday builder .

name: Fantastic Race
description: Part treasure hunt, part reality show, Fantastic Race offers a fun and exciting way to see Hollywood and downtown LA's iconic attractions. This unique sightseeing tour is ideal for travelers into competing and puzzle solving. You'll have to be prepared to put not only your mind but also your body to work, since the race involves a lot of hiking, running, and even crawling in some sections. Remember to put on some comfortable shoes and bring a bottle of water. With our world travel planner, Los Angeles attractions like Fantastic Race can be center stage of your vacation plans, and you can find out about other attractions like it, unlike it, near it, and miles away.

address: 4100 S La Cienega Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90056, USA
name: Kenneth Hahn State Recreation Area
description: Explore the verdant hiking trails of Kenneth Hahn State Recreation Area, an oasis in the heart of Los Angeles. Spread over 162 ha (401 acres), the park grounds provide plenty of space for exercise or relaxation. Choose one of several treks to discover scenic views of Santa Monica Mountains, the city skyline, and the Pacific Ocean. Take a peaceful stroll through the Japanese garden, or enjoy a picnic in one of the many rest areas. Amenities in the park include basketball and volleyball courts, barbecue pits, and a lake for fishing. Using our online itinerary creator, Los Angeles attractions like Kenneth Hahn State Recreation Area can form part of a personalized travel itinerary.

name: The Wende Museum of the Cold War
description: The Wende Museum of the Cold War is located in Culver City. Plan your visit to The Wende Museum of the Cold War and a wealth of other attractions, well-known and undiscovered, using our Culver City tour itinerary builder website .

address: 3764 Watseka Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90034, USA
name: Diorama-museum of Bhagavad-gita
description: The Diorama-museum of Bhagavad-gita consists of eleven stunning life-size dioramas of clay-work dolls in display since 1977. It combines India’s ancient yogic wisdom and sculpture artistry with America’s state-of-the-art multimedia technology. To visit Diorama-museum of Bhagavad-gita and other attractions in Los Angeles, use our Los Angeles day trip site .

address: Third Street between Wilshire Boulevard and Broadway, Santa Monica, CA 90401
name: Third Street Promenade
description: Drawing locals and world travelers alike, Downtown Santa Monica is a popular Southern California coastal destination, minutes from beaches and the Pacific Ocean.

address: Santa Monica Pier, Santa Monica, CA 90401
name: Santa Monica Farmers Market
description: Breathe in the essence of Southern California's healthful lifestyle at Santa Monica Farmers Market, which offers a wide array of locally grown produce. Browse the stalls overflowing with colorful goods and feast your senses on fresh fruit and vegetables. Many of the area's top chefs supply their hip restaurants from this popular market. Using our international travel planner, Santa Monica attractions like Santa Monica Farmers Market can form part of a personalized travel itinerary.

address: 200 Santa Monica Pier, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA
name: Santa Monica Pier
description: Experience the vibrant, timeless energy of southern California with a walk down Santa Monica Pier. The 100-year-old wooden wharf serves as the area's hub of entertainment and culture. This spot is home to the Pacific Park amusement park, the Santa Monica Pier Aquarium, an array of shops and eateries, and plenty of street artists. Rent bikes and spend the afternoon exploring the carnival-like atmosphere while enjoying the oceanside scenery. Kids love visiting the Playland Arcade, which has more than 200 games and attractions. The pier also is home to California's only over-water Ferris wheel. For Santa Monica Pier and beyond, use our Santa Monica trip itinerary planner to get the most from your Santa Monica vacation.

address: 1151 Oxford Rd, San Marino, CA, United States
name: The Huntington Desert Garden
description: The Huntington Desert Garden is part of The Huntington Library, Art Collections and Botanical Gardens in San Marino, California. The Desert Garden is one of the world's largest and oldest collections of cacti, succulents and other desert plants, collected from throughout the world. It contains plants from extreme environments, many of which were acquired by Henry E. Huntington and William Hertrich (the first garden curator) in trips taken to several countries in North, Central and South America. One of the Huntington’s most botanically important gardens, the Desert Garden brought together a group of plants largely unknown and unappreciated in the beginning of the 1900s. Containing a broad category of xerophytes (aridity-adapted plants), the Desert Garden grew to preeminence and remains today among the world’s finest, with more than 5,000 species in the 10 acre (4 ha) garden.Mr. Huntington was not initially interested in establishing a Desert Garden. He did not like cacti at all, due to some unfortunate prickly pear encounters during railroad construction work. But Hertrich was persistent, and, once won over, Mr. Huntington built a railway spur to his garden, to bring in rock, soil and plants by the carload. As Gary Lyons, a later curator, remarked, it's very convenient to have a rail spur, and deep pockets, when you're building a big garden. A trip to Arizona in 1908 filled three railroad cars for the trip back to the garden.

address: 4101 Las Posas Rd, Camarillo, CA 93010, USA
name: Camarillo Public Library
description: The Camarillo Library is a public library located in the city of Camarillo, California and is operated by Library Systems & Services. We offer community events, literacy programs, children's and teens programs and much more....We also have the Russell Fischer Business Collection which offers a great selection of business and marketing books along with free programs for start ups and entrepreneurs. Our library also has it's own Seed Library, which  can be found here: https://www.facebook.com/CamarilloLibrarySeedLibrary/
